Champerty.definition: -ties [Anglo-French champartie bargaining for a share of disputed property
Champerty.origin: [Anglo-French champartie bargaining for a share of disputed property, from champart share of crops paid as rent, share of property in dispute, from champ field + part portion]

-ties.definition: [Anglo-Frenchbargaining for a share of disputed property, fromshare of crops paid as rent, share of property in dispute, fromfield +portion]an unenforceable agreement by which a person with otherwise no interest in a lawsuit agrees to aid in or carry on its litigation in consideration of a share of the subject matter of the suit (as property or damages) compare
